It is in the eastern part of the Cardamom Mountains. To protect the biodiversity of the mountains, Phnom Aural Wildlife Sanctuary was established in 1993. This mountain in located in Aoral District, Kampong Speu Province.

famous_places.name: Kirirom National Park
famous_places.description: officially called Preah Suramarit-Kossamak Kirirom National Park, is a national park in Cambodia located in the eastern part of the Cardamom Mountains at a mean elevation of 675 m (2,215 ft). It is Cambodia's first officially designated national park. The meaning of 'Kirirom' is 'Happy Mountain'. This name was given to the area by King Monivong in the 1930s. The ancient name of the place was Phnom Vorvong Sorvong for the main two hills there were connected with the Cambodian popular legend about two heroic princely brothers Vorvong and Sorvong.

famous_places.name: Chreav Waterfall
famous_places.description: Chreav Waterfall is in the category of the Waterfall, Natural tourism site. Things to do, as well as the attractions of Chreav Waterfall for you such as Swimming, Having picnic, Trekking, Cottage and more. it is easy because it is not necessary to walk and cross the river or take a boat. For parking, you can park directly at the location.

famous_places.name: Coconut School
famous_places.description: The name 'Kirirom' meaning Mountain of Joy was given to it by the King of Cambodia. Kirirom National Park, a high-altitude plateau, is known for its unique high elevation pine forest, which forms the headwaters for numerous streams feeding Kampong Speu Town. Besides this, we are one of the main schools called Coconut School where is the center that organized kid from the village and some of them were homeless and suffered from starvation.

All_Provinces.title: Steng Treng
All_Provinces.Description: A charming province located on a high sandy bank overlooking Mekong River, is about 455 km North of Phnom Penh and 40 km south of the Laos border. The town is link to Banlung (Ratanakiri) and serves more than just a stopover. It is an important trading hub between Cambodia and Laos. The Sekong Bridge provides a convenient gateway from the border of Laos.

famous_places.name: Kampi Dolphin Site
famous_places.description: Kampi is the best place in Cambodia to see the rare Mekong River Dolphin. Kampi Dolphin pool is the most inhabited dolphin pool in the Mekong River with about 20 dolphins. Kampi Dolphin Site was established in 1999 to welcome international and local tourists and for scientific researchers to study the Mekong River Dolphin.

famous_places.name: Watching Seam Pang Bird
famous_places.image: /Seam Pang Bird & Wildlife Watching at Western Siem Pang.webp
famous_places.description: Bird watching in Seam Pang can be undertaken in Virak Chey National Park, which is home to hundreds of bird species, many of which are endangered. December through March is the best time to visit this highland bird sanctuary when many of the lowland ponds inside the area and Virak Chey National Park have dried up and most of the birds fly along the upper Se Kong River. Seam Pang with its verdant and lush tropical forests is one of the best nature conservation regions in the province. However, this remote wildlife area is only accessible by boat from Stung Treng town to Seam Pang district town about 80 km. away. Then the journey is continued by hiring a small rowboat or by bicycling through this tranquil and unspoiled wildlife paradise. The ten park rangers are the best guides for visitors. There is one local guest house named 'Theany Guesthouse' established a few years ago for your accommodation and meals.

famous_places.name: Preah Ko Temple
famous_places.description: Preah Ko temple was built using only a few distinct materials, mostly red brick and sandstone. Today, what remains of this temple is the main tower and several temple ruins surrounding the main tower. it was built in the 6th-7th Centuries, during the reign of King Jayavarman I, in dedication to Brahmanism religion.
famous_places.map: Location: The Preah Ko temple site is located in Thala commune, Thala Borivath district, about  two kilometers from the provincial town.

famous_places.name: Preah Rumkel
famous_places.description: the first home stays were set up by several communities under the guidelines of a tourist expert. These home stays are idea for visitors who want to experience how local villagers live. There are many attractive sites such as the Sopeakmith waterfall (Preah Nimith Waterfall), which has extremely strong flow during the rainy season although low flow during the dry season. Tourists can reach Preah Rumkel communities’ eco-tourism area by boat, just an hour from Stung Treng town. The cost per person round trip is 50,000 riel (US$12.25). Visitors can enjoy the spectacular views of trees while floating down the river and also see many different kinds of birds.

famous_places.name: Ramsar of Cambodia’s Mekong River
famous_places.description: Ramsar is a word meaning ‘wetland conservation area’. In the Kingdom of Cambodia. The Royal Government of Cambodia classified this upper Mekong River area as a Ramsar conservation area of the kingdom in 1999. It covers 14,600 hectares of the surrounding river area. We can see most of the mangrove trees along the river have many roots with some trees having roots far up the side of the tree. As the water level goes down, the roots appear to climb up a higher portion of the tree. But during the rainy season, most of the tree is under water. These trees are very tall and some can reach 20 meters in height. One of the highlights of the Ramsar area is the Mekong dolphin. There is a large group of dolphins living along this conservation zone, Seang Tana said The Royal Government of Cambodia has set up a Dolphin Authority to protect this very rare mammal.

All_Provinces.title: Mondolkiri
All_Provinces.Description: Mondulkiri is about 543km north of Phnom Penh. Known as its forested hills and beautiful waterfalls, Mondulkiri is one of the most popular destinations for Eco-tourism in Cambodia.

famous_places.name: Rum Near II waterfall
famous_places.description: During the rainy season, the waterfall is 3 meters in height and 10 meters in diameter. During the dry season, the waterfall is 4 meters in height and 6 meters in diameter. there is a big water reservoir in which tourists can swim happily. Besides, there are many big trees providing cool shade for them. Its main points of interest are a spectacular waterfall, dramatic mountainous forest, impressive undulating hills, and fresh air.
famous_places.map: Location: In Pourang Village, Sèn Monorom Commune, Oreang District; 12 km from the provincial town. It can be accessed by the Road No. 76.

famous_places.name: Phnom Kraol Resort
famous_places.description: The main point of interest is a place of worship on the mountaintop for the residents. Many tourists visit here to pray for happiness and prosperity. Nowadays, it is main tourist attraction which draws inbound international and internal tourists.
famous_places.map: Location: Orayes Village, Sre Sangkom Commune, Koh Nheak District, Mondulkiri Province, 3 km from center of Koh Nheak District and 111 km from Senmonorom City.

famous_places.name: Pou Tang Village
famous_places.description: The main points of interest are spectacular waterfall, dramatic mountainous forest, impressive undulated hills, fresh air and local villages of indigenous people. This area provide a good opportunity to explor for pinic, trekking, swimming. Especially, it can be introduced visiting local villages and the culture of the indigenous people and shopping the souvenirs made by local people.
famous_places.map: Location: Poules and Pouchhob villages, Dakdam Commune, Ou Reang District, Mondulkiri Province, 20 km from Senmonorom City.

famous_places.name: Samuth Chher
famous_places.description: It is a nice place for a great view over the hills and forests of Mondulkiri. That’s why called Ocean Tree? It is not full of water, but it is full of trees. When we view from the top of the hill, the tree seem waving like ocean water

famous_places.name: Romanea I waterfall
famous_places.description: It is close to the plantations like rubber, coffee, cashew, mango, avocado, and pres. Its main points of interest are a spectacular waterfall, dramatic mountainous forest, impressive undulating hills, and fresh air.

famous_places.name: Chrey Yos Waterfall
famous_places.description: Its main points of interest are a spectacular waterfall, dramatic mountainous forest, impressive undulating hills, and fresh air. This resort is managed by the provincial executive committee. It is partly supported financially by the DANIDA Organization of Denmark.
famous_places.map: Location: In Laoka Village, Sokhdom Commune and Pouloung Village, Romanea Commune, Sèn Monorom District; 6 km from the provincial town. It can be accessed by the red pebble path.

famous_places.name: Leng Tao Waterfall
famous_places.description: There are 143 families living in the Lèng Tao area, whose main occupations are farming. Its main points of interest are a spectacular waterfall, dramatic mountainous forest, impressive undulating hills, and fresh air.
famous_places.map: Location: is located in Pouloung Village, Romanea Commune, Sèn Monorom District; 15 km from the provincial town. It can be reached by path.

famous_places.name: Lek Pok Bras Waterfall
famous_places.description: During the rainy season, the waterfall is 8 meters in height and 39 meters in diameter. During the dry season, the waterfall is 10 meters in height and 20 meters in diameter. Its main points of interest are a spectacular waterfall, dramatic mountainous forest, impressive undulating hills, and fresh air. Next to Lak Pok Bras waterfall is the home indigenous ethnic group people living for centuries and remains a center for cultural diversity in this region. These minority such as Phnong, Stieng, Kuoy, Tum Poun and Charay people continue to depend on the natural resources of Mondulkiri province for their survival.
famous_places.map: Location: is located in Romanea Commune, Sen Monorom District; 13 km from the provincial town. It can be reached by path.

famous_places.name: Sen Monorum Waterfall
famous_places.description: Sen Monorum waterfall has three stages: - First stage: The waterfall has slow speed, one-meter height and 2-4 meter diameter. - Second stage: During the rainy season, the waterfall has strong speed, 6-7 meter height and 8-meter diameter. During the dry season, the waterfall has 7-9 meter height and 4-5 meter diameter. At the waterfall, there is a large space of resting and enjoying.
famous_places.map: Location: is located at Sen Monorum District in five-kilometer distance from the provincial town by red soil trail

famous_places.name: Plantation of Pinetree
famous_places.description: A large pine tree plantation where hundreds of towering pine tree, planted before 1970, are growing in rows. Fallen needles from the trees turn the ground into a golden carpet. The needles are so numerous that visitors can lie on the ground without disturbing them. Pine trees are believed to have been planted before then Prince Norodom Sihanouk founded his Sangkum Reastr Niyum regime, at which time the province was created.In addition, according to hunters in the province, there are more than 60 waterfalls, both big and small, making Mondulkiri province a potential source for hydro electric power.

famous_places.name: Chrey Thom Waterfall
famous_places.description: During the dry season, the waterfall has 15 meters height and 2 meters diameter, and during the rainy season, the waterfall has 11 meters height and 8 meters diameter. The waterfall fall us near a plantation of Srolao trees and a big, branchy Chrey tree.The provincial tourist service is working with the local authority to prepare this site as a tourist destination in place of Busra waterfall, which is inaccessible during rainy season. The travelers are amazed to see the plantation of Sro Lou around the Chrey Thom Waterfall, Mondulkiri. Another spectacle around the Chrey Thom Waterfall, Mondulkiri Is the huge brandy tree of Chrey which is standing there for quite a long time.

famous_places.name: Bousra Waterfall
famous_places.description: Busra is considered by many to be the most beautiful waterfall in Mondulkiri. First Stage: The waterfall fall is 8 to 12 meters high and 15 meters wide in rainy season and 10 to 15 meters wide in dry season. Second Stage: The waterfall fall is 15 to 20 meters high and 20 meters wide in rainy season and 18 to 25 meters high and 13 meters wide in dry season. The second stage is 150 meters from the first stage. Third Stage: The speed of waterfall is faster than the second stage. This stage cannot be reached because it is in the thick forest. There are no marked paths and dangerous wildlife inhabits the area.

All_Provinces.title: Ratanakiri
All_Provinces.Description: Ratanakiri is a province of Cambodia located in the remote northeast. It borders the provinces of Mondulkiri to the south and Stung Treng to the west and the countries of Laos and Vietnam to the north and east, respectively. The province extends from the mountains of the Annamite Range in the north, across a hilly plateau between the Tonle San and Tonle Srepok rivers, to tropical deciduous forests in the south. In recent years, logging and mining have scarred Ratanakiri's environment, long known for its beauty.

famous_places.name: Beung Yeak Laom
famous_places.description: The beautiful lake occupies a 4000-year-old volcanic crater. Due to the lake’s tremendous depth 48 m(157 ft), its water is exceptionally clean and clear. The lake is almost perfectly round and measures 0.72 km (0.45 mi in diameter. Large tree and rich, lush rain forest, the home of many exotic bird and parts, surround the lake. There are two places along the bank where visitors can relax and enjoy a panoramic view of the lake and the flora and fauna. A tourist information center is on the west bank, and handicrafts make by hill tribes living nearly are available for sale.

famous_places.name: Virachey National Park
famous_places.description: Vrachey National Park is one of the largest protected areas in Cambodia, stretching for 3325 sq km east to Vietnam, north to Laos and west to Stung Treng Province. The park has never been fully explored and is home to a number of rare mammals, including elephants, clouded leopards and sun bears, although your chances of seeing of these creatures are extremely slim. However, you’ll probably hear endangered gibbons and you might spot great hornbill, giant ibis and other rare birds. So important is the park to the Mekong region that it was designated an Asean Heritage Park in 2003. And it is only possible to visit the park on organized treks booked though the Virachey national Park Eco-Tourism Information Centre in Ban Lung.

famous_places.name: Ka Chanh Waterfall
famous_places.description: Among the stream and rubber plantation, the Kachanh Waterfall provides great scenery for tourist. The stream’s bottom can be accessed by a wooden stair having approximately 72 steps. On the side of the top of the waterfall, big trees branching out cast cool shadows over tourists for picnicking there. And beside the stream, there is a stand stair build in 1998 for tourist to get on the elephant’s back for their enjoyable riding.

famous_places.name: Cha Ong Waterfall
famous_places.description: The waterfall gets its water from Phnom Eysei Patamak or Phnom Svay near Ban Loung provincial town. From  its upper level. A mountain slop leads visitors to the bottom of the waterfall, where they can sit inside a cave and enjoy the view. The situation from above is a small canal which continuously flows through the broken rocks, then to the stream below in 25-kilometer height. To view the waterfall, we should go down to the stream below where we have seen a big rocky cabe with plain roof. At the bottom of the stream, there are many big rock used as the seats for viewing the great and interesting water falling down from the mountaintop.

famous_places.name: Veal Ram Plang
famous_places.description: Veal Ram Plang means the Ram Plang field and is an attractive nature spot that is part of the territories of the legendary hill tribe communities living there. It is a mesa plateau area on the top of a mountain in Ratanakiri Province. On this field are grass and wild plants, which flower during the whole rainy season from May till January.  Near the field is a small, clean river.

famous_places.name: Ou Chaloy Ranatakiri
famous_places.description: Chaloy, Ratanakiri is a popular tourist attraction in this colorful region of Cambodia. Ou Chaloy in Ratanakiri is located on this river, 34 kilometers southwest of Banlung, the provincial capital. To enjoy the recreation options for tourists here, you have to visit the Ou Chaloy, Ratanakiri during the dry season. Include the destination in your itinerary for a satisfactory tour of the colorful Ratanakiri.
famous_places.map: Location: Ou'Chaloy is located in the Sre Pok river It is situated 34km. south - west of Banlung.

All_Provinces.title: Koh Kong
All_Provinces.Description: From 1795 to 1904 the area was under Siamese administration with the local name of Koh Kong. In 1907 Koh Kong remained part of French Cambodia. Koh Kong city, the capital of Koh Kong province, is a large forested area with mangroves, rivers, waterfalls and tropical islands The most southwestern province of Cambodia, Koh Kong has a long undeveloped coastline and a mountainous, forested, and largely inaccessible interior which includes part of the Cardamom Mountains, Cambodia's largest national park (Botum Sakor National Park), and a section of Kirirom National Park.). Koh Kong was recently listed by The Lonely Planet Guidebook as one of the best eco-tourism places in the world to visit.  There are a few eco-tourist lodges outside the town in the jungle and on the rivers, and hundreds of kilometers of unspoiled jungles for the real adventurer.  Many destinations are only accessible by foot, boat, motorcycle or cow.

famous_places.name: Tatai Waterfall
famous_places.description: The scenic beauty of the Tatay Waterfalls draws many travelers to Koh Kong. Here, visitors may climb up to the individual small falls and take a refreshing dip in the crystal-clear waters. Aside from swimming, one may also pack a lunch and picnic on the big rocks surrounding the falls. Travelers can arrange for boat rides or kayaks to paddle out to the falls. A ride back from the falls during sunset is especially captivating.

famous_places.name: Koh Kong Krav
famous_places.description: Known as the “largest island in Cambodia”, Kor Kong Krau is one of the most beautiful islands in Koh Kong Province known by its beautiful beach, clear blue sea, forest surround the island and also Kor Kong Krau has its own waterfall inside the island which it is hardly to find anywhere else besides Kor Kong Krau. Koh Mool is famous for a short trip from the charming town of Koh Kong. If you love fishing, finding snail, catching octopus, and dive to see a beautiful create under the sea. Apart from the lovely retreats one can find stunning cascading waterfalls. Travelers can also visit a number of small springs, and engage in dolphin watching. Young children will enjoy the dolphin show that is organized by the Koh Mool Resort (Kor Kong Krau). A walk on the beach in the moonlight is also an experience you will never forget. You can visit the village in the island and explore the culture and get to know more about Khmer culture.

famous_places.name: Khun Chhlagn Khun Phen
famous_places.description: The Khun Chhlagn Khun Phen Resort is situated at a strategic point in front of the provincial town of Koh Kong. Koh Kong consists of a stupa which is located on a huge rock placed at the middle of the vast expanse of the blue sea. This is one of the major meeting places of the local people during the festive days. International travelers coming also come here visit the Khun Chhalgn Khun Phen Resort in Koh Kong during the days of the traditional festival and to get insight into the rich cultural heritage of the Cambodia.

famous_places.name: Lam Da Beach
famous_places.description: At Lam Da Beach, you can spend some time amidst sea, sand and serenity. The long stretch of golden beach shining in the warm rays of the sun makes it a favorite tourist spot for young and old alike. It takes around one hour and forty-five minutes to get to Lam Da Beach, which is ideally situated about twenty kilometers away from the provincial town. Kids as well as all adults will enjoy the calm waters of the sea and the picturesque surroundings.

famous_places.name: Kbal Chhay Waterfall
famous_places.description: The Kbal Chhay Prek Koh Waterfalls offer spectacular views and an escape to serenity. The Kbal Chhay Prek Koh Waterfall is home to nature and wildlife reserves where the travelers might see some of the rare species of flora and fauna. The spot is also perfect for family picnics.

famous_places.name: Sner Beach
famous_places.description: Sner Beach is a frequently visited tourist attraction in Koh Kong. Visitors from different corners of the world prefer Sner Beach as it boasts a stunning coastline. You can either hire a car or drive down on your own to Sner Beach. The natural beauty of the beach and its adjoining areas, which lie tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the cities, compels tourists to come back here time and again.

famous_places.name: Cham Yeam Resort
famous_places.description: Cham Yeam is a semi-natural site developed 1997 by Neak Oknha Li Yong Phat. He names it Koh Kong International Resort. Today it attracts many tourists, especially Thais. Cham Yeam Resort is one of the most beautiful resorts in Cambodia because it has five-star hotels, guest houses, several casinos and international zoo, Koh Kong Safari World. Cham Yeam Beach features beautiful coconut trees. The Cham Yeam border checkpoint

famous_places.name: Koh Sdach Island
famous_places.description: It attracts visitors from Sihanoukville and Sre Ambil district.Koh Sdech features a long beach, and the sea is filled with a variety of fish. The site is excellent for snorkeling or scuba diving, as the water is clear, and an array of coral can be seen growing at the bottom of the sea.

All_Provinces.title: Oddor Meanchey
All_Provinces.Description: It is a province of Cambodia in the remote northwest. It borders the provinces of Banteay Meanchey to the west, Siem Reap to the south and Preah Vihear to the east. Its long northern boundary demarcates part of Cambodia's international border with Thailand. The capital is Samraong. The province was created on 27 April 1999, after being carved from the northern half of Siem Reap province and part of Banteay Meanchey.

famous_places.name: Tamok House
famous_places.description: It is a house once owned by former Khmer Rouge Commander Ta Mok. From 1979 until late 1997, this area was organized and controlled by the Khmer Rouge armies. Some remaining statues describe the way the rebels lived and how they arranged their troops during their bloody struggle against the government. in the forest is a pile of tires which is believed to be the funeral pyre and burial site of Pol Pot, the leader of Khmer Rouge. Many tourists go to Anlong Veng to see and photograph the sites and activities associated with the former regime, and the government has discussed turning this area into a historical site to attract even more tourists.

famous_places.name: O'Smach
famous_places.description: The town features a resort which includes a number of casinos, good restaurants and luxury hotels. The resort has been organized by the Royal Group and VIP Shop Group companies.The O Smach Resort has an impressive entry complete with a giant glowing green lotus set in a fountain. The resort has beautifully maintained grounds which feature, for some unknown reason, two military armoured vehicles decorated with Christmas lights.

famous_places.name: Cham Pey Waterfall
famous_places.description: Besides the waterfall at the mountain valley, the natural complex is covered with many trees and lots of orchids and other colorful flowers. Not quite far from the waterfall is another natural and cultural site named Rut Cham Pey and organized by monks who are meditating there. In Rut Cham Pey, tourists can see many statues depicting the process of human life, religious and animal figures.
famous_places.map: Location: is located about 35km from the provincial town along the road No 68.

famous_places.name: Prasat Ta Muen Thom
famous_places.description: Its Khmer name translates literally to Great Temple of Grandfather Chicken. It lies not far from two related temples in a densely forested area where access is difficult on one of the passes through the Dangrek Mountains. Because of its location on the Thai side of the current border, the temple is only accessible from Thailand. Access from Cambodia would be difficult because the ancient Khmer Highway that led to the pass has long since been retaken by the jungle. During the Cambodian–Thai border dispute (2009-2011) which was primarily centered around ownership of Preah Vihear Temple, border clashes spread to Ta Muen and access to the temple was temporarily closed. Afterwards, tensions remain high and tourists at the temple are not allowed to venture more than a few meters southward from the main entrance and armed Thai border police stand guard to mark the border.
